name: Denesse Willey’s Fresh Plum Cake
keywords: dessert, flour, plum, sugar, nut-free, summer

recipeInstructions.text:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Lightly grease an 9-inch-by 13-inch
baking pan. In the bowl of a food
processor, combine flours, baking
powder, salt and 1/4 cup sugar. Add 6
tablespoons cold butter and pulse
until it is the consistency of corn meal.
In a measuring cup, beat together
the eggs and vanilla; add enough milk
to make 1 cup. With the processor
running, pour in milk mixture; a soft
sticky dough will form. Scrape the
dough into the pan, and with a greased
spatula press the dough to cover
the bottom of the pan. Press in the fruit, skin side down until it uniformly
covers the dough. (Distribute the dough
more evenly by pushing it with the
fruit sections.) Sprinkle oatmeal over all.
Distribute 1/2 cup sugar over the
oatmeal. Sprinkle on spices. Dot with
remaining 6 tablespoons cold butter.

Bake about 25 minutes. Serve warm
(but not hot) with ice cream for dessert.
Refrigerate leftovers for breakfast.
